wikipedia_page.main: James Tindal Soutter (1 January 1885, Echt, Aberdeenshire – 8 August 1966, Edinburgh) was a Scottish athlete who competed mainly in the 400 metres.He competed for Great Britain and Ireland at the 1912 Summer Olympics held in Stockholm, Sweden, in the 4 x 400 metre relay where he won the bronze medal with his team mates George Nicol, Ernest Henley and Cyril Seedhouse.
